authority: Semantic guidance only; exercise_file.schema.json defines valid structure and any enum constraints.

status.active: This exercise definition is current and expected to appear in normal use.
status.archived: This exercise definition is no longer current. It may be retained for history/compatibility but should not be used for new programming.

lifecycle.effective_start_date: YYYY-MM-DD or null. When known, the date this definition became active.
lifecycle.effective_end_date: YYYY-MM-DD or null. When known, the date this definition stopped being active (e.g., when archived).

_meta.schema_alignment: Matches $defs.tags: functional[], format[], heatmap[] (all required; arrays of strings; no enums).
_meta.rule: Because schema does not constrain tag values, all tag vocab below is guidance only.

_meta.note: Functional tags are permitted by schema but are effectively deprecated in favor of exercise roles. Keep empty unless a legacy tag is required for backward compatibility.

_meta.rule: Format tags describe the execution position or structural format. Use consistent, reusable strings.

format.kneeling: Performed in kneeling (tall kneel or half kneel).
format.dynamic_control: Primarily dynamic movement with control emphasis.

_meta.note: Heatmap tags are permitted by schema but deprecated in practice. Nothing relies on them; do not expand or re-interpret.

pt_category.back_sij: Lumbar spine, pelvis, or SIJ-focused exercises.
pt_category.vestibular: Balance/vestibular system emphasis (gaze stabilization, habituation, sensory integration).
pt_category.other: Does not fit a single primary category.

_meta.dosage_rule: Base pattern defines how sets Ã— reps (or equivalent) are interpreted before any modifiers are applied.

side.definition: Unilateral dosage. Sets and reps are prescribed per side.
side.dosage_semantics: NxM means N sets of M repetitions on EACH side (left and right).
side.logging: Completion requires both sides to be performed unless program specifies otherwise.
side.example: 2x10 = 2 sets of 10 on the right AND 2 sets of 10 on the left.

both.definition: Bilateral dosage. Sets and reps are performed with both sides simultaneously.
both.dosage_semantics: NxM means N sets of M repetitions total, not per side.
both.logging: Logged as a single bilateral unit.

_meta.rule: Modifiers alter how dosage is measured or executed but do not change the base pattern unless explicitly stated.

duration_seconds.definition: Replaces repetition count with time per set.
duration_seconds.dosage_semantics: NxT means N sets, each lasting T seconds.
duration_seconds.interaction: Applies equally to 'side' and 'both'. For 'side', duration is per side unless combined with 'alternating'.

hold_seconds.definition: Adds an isometric hold component to each repetition or set.
hold_seconds.dosage_semantics: Hold time is applied per rep unless otherwise specified in program notes.
hold_seconds.interaction: Does not replace reps or duration; it augments them.
hold_seconds.example: 3x10 with 5s hold = 3 sets of 10 reps, each rep held for 5 seconds.

AMRAP.definition: As many repetitions as possible within a defined duration.
AMRAP.dosage_semantics: Reps are not pre-specified; time is the controlling variable.
AMRAP.example: AMRAP 30s = perform as many reps as possible in 30 seconds.

distance_feet.dosage_semantics: NxD means N sets, each covering D feet.
distance_feet.interaction: With 'side', distance is per side unless combined with 'alternating'.

alternating.definition: Sides alternate within a single set rather than completing all reps on one side first.
alternating.dosage_semantics: Total reps per side remain the same as 'side'; execution order changes only.
alternating.example: 2x5 side + alternating = 2 sets of 5 reps per side, alternating left-right-left-right.

_meta.rule: These are REQUIRED-at-program-layer keys. This vocabulary defines meaning, not allowed values.

form_parameters_required.eyes: Visual condition during execution (e.g., eyes open, eyes closed, tracking).
form_parameters_required.surface: Surface condition used during execution (e.g., firm, foam, BOSU).
form_parameters_required.strap_position: Strap placement location when using a strap.
form_parameters_required.distance: Measured spatial parameter (e.g., step height, reach distance).

_meta.schema_alignment: Equipment is not an enum in schema; it is an object with required[] and optional[] arrays of strings.
_meta.rule: Equipment represents physical objects or environmental supports required to perform an exercise.

equipment.usage: Prefer values drawn from existing equipment strings in exercise_library.json, plus 'other' when needed.
